Bash(wsl.exe -e bash -c "ssh -p 2222 -i /mnt/c/Claude_FileSystem/llm-orchestrator/LLM-Operations/vault/orchestrator-key -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no LLM-CCode_Codex@192.168.1.250 ''sudo pct exec 170 -- cat > /tmp/boot.ipxe.new << ""EOF""
#!ipxe

# Proxmox VE 9.0 UEFI PXE Boot Configuration
# Corrected for UEFI compatibility - NO sanhook/ISO mounting

set http 192.168.1.248
set boot-url http://$http/boot/proxmox
set rootfs-url http://$http/proxmox/pve-installer.squashfs

# Display boot info
echo ================================================
echo Proxmox VE 9.0 Automated UEFI PXE Boot
echo ================================================
echo Boot Server: $http
echo Kernel: $boot-url/vmlinuz
echo Initrd: $boot-url/initrd.img  
echo RootFS: $rootfs-url
echo Config: $boot-url/auto-install.toml
echo ================================================

# Get DHCP lease
dhcp || echo DHCP failed, continuing with existing network config

# Boot Proxmox directly from kernel + initrd + squashfs
# No ISO mounting required for UEFI
echo Loading kernel...
kernel $boot-url/vmlinuz boot=live fetch=$rootfs-url proxmox-start-auto-installer auto-installer-mode=http auto-installer-config-url=$boot-url/auto-install.toml console=tty0 console=ttyS0,115200

echo Loading initrd...
initrd $boot-url/initrd.img

echo Booting Proxmox VE...
boot || goto failed

:failed
echo ================================================
echo Boot failed! Check the following:
echo 1. Network connectivity to $http
echo 2. Files exist: vmlinuz, initrd.img, squashfs
echo 3. Auto-install.toml configuration
echo ================================================
sleep 30
exit
EOF
''")

# Proxmox VE Auto-Install Configuration - TEST MODE
# Generic config for testing PXE boot on various hardware
# Uses first available disk (no filtering)

[global]
keyboard = ""en-us""
country = ""us""
fqdn = ""pxe-test.home.sth0ck""
mailto = ""jdotx87@gmail.com""
timezone = ""America/Chicago""
root-password = ""Sth0ck.517+ADM1n""

[network]
source = ""from-dhcp""
# Auto-detect first working interface via DHCP

[disk-setup]
filesystem = ""ext4""
# NO FILTER - Uses first available disk automatically
# This allows testing on any hardware without disk-specific filters
# For production TR1920 deployment, use auto-install.toml with SAMSUNG filter
TOMLEOF
cat /tmp/auto-install-test.toml")
